bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Harry Clemons, June 24, 1940

div1.p: Hench requests copies of the Kean and Moran letters from Clemons at the University of Virginia Alderman Library. Hench eventually intends to donate copies of his research material to the Army Medical Museum and to the University of Virginia.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Harry Clemons, June 24, 1940
div1.opener:
Y F.
June 24, 1940
Mr. Harry Clemons, Librarian
Alderman Library
University of Virginia
Charlottesville, Virginia
My dear Mr. Clemons:
div1.p:
I do appreciate very much receiving the copy of the letter from Mr. Moran
to Dr. Paul Barringer. I am having copies made of the Kean letter and the Moran
letter to you. I wish now that I had had photostatic copies made of them, and if
it is still possible to get them, I would much prefer to have them, as they look
so much more authentic, but if this can be done please let me pay for it. I do
not wish to impose on the generosity of yourself and the library. If you prefer,
could you have the photostatic copy made of this material and keep it for yourself,
and let me keep the copy that I have, but pay for it at your regular rates? Rest
assured that I will send you in due time, not only the various photographs that I
have of Camp Lazear, etc. but a synopsis of my investigations, in published and un-
published form. As I told you, I must get the material ready in documentary form
for the Cuban government, but I also expect to publish one or two notes on the
matter in medical historical journals.

I consider your library and the Army Medical Museum as the two proper
places for depositing the various material that I have, and I will see to it
that you have copies of everything that you will wish of what I have.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
